citation.abstract: To test whether communicating cardiovascular diseases (CVD) risk using a novel risk assessment tool (Heart Age) will be able to motivate a population to adopt healthier lifestyles and improve CVD risk profile over the use of a traditional percentage-based tool.
citation.title: Effectiveness of the Heart Age tool for improving modifiable cardiovascular risk factors in a Southern European population: a randomized trial

news.title: New study uses heart age calculator to motivate people to adopt healthier lifestyles

news.title: Your heart is probably much older than you think, the CDC warns
news.summary: You may feel young at heart, but with apologies to Frank Sinatra , that's probably a fairy tale. A new report from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says the average American man has a heart that's 7.8 years "older" than his chronological age;

news.title: 3 in 4 Americans have hearts 'older' than their age, say CDC officials
news.summary: Three out of four U.S. adults aged 30 to 74 have a predicted “heart age” that is older than their chronological age, putting them at increased risk for heart disease and stroke, according to a study published Tuesday by the Centers for Disease Control and

news.title: What's your real age?
news.summary: Age is a peculiar concept. We tend to think of it as the number of birthdays we have celebrated -- our chronological age.

blogs.title: What is your 'effective age'?
blogs.summary:
How old are you? 
You might, quite reasonably, calculate your chronological age as the time elapsed since you were born.   But what is the effective age of your body?
